title: Marriage in Islam
introduction: Marriage (*nikah*) is a sacred contract in Islam that brings love, mercy, and stability to individuals, families, and society. It is an act of worship when done with the right intention, helping spouses protect their faith, fulfill natural needs in a lawful way, and build righteous families who live according to Allah’s guidance. Allah describes marriage as one of His signs of mercy and wisdom.

sections.heading: Purpose of Marriage
sections.content: Allah says: *'And among His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you may find tranquility in them; and He placed between you affection and mercy.'* (Quran 30:21). The main purposes of marriage are to find comfort and companionship, guard modesty, and build a loving home where children are raised with good manners and strong faith. It is a partnership of mutual support where both help each other grow closer to Allah.

sections.heading: Rights and Duties
sections.content: Islam sets clear rights and responsibilities for both husband and wife to protect fairness and kindness. Husbands are commanded to treat their wives with respect and honor: *'And live with them in kindness…'* (Quran 4:19). Wives should respect their husbands and support them in faith and family life. Both should fulfill each other’s physical, emotional, and financial rights, help each other in worship, and avoid harming or neglecting one another. The Prophet ﷺ said: *'The best of you are the best to their families, and I am the best to my family.'* (Tirmidhi).

sections.heading: Keys to a Happy Marriage
sections.content: A successful marriage is built on strong faith, respect, and love for the sake of Allah. Good communication is essential — listen patiently, speak kindly, and solve problems with wisdom. Be patient and forgiving of each other’s mistakes. Practice gratitude and show appreciation for one another’s efforts. Make dua together and put Allah at the center of the relationship. Remember that no marriage is perfect, but the goal is to grow together with mercy and understanding.

conclusion: A successful marriage in Islam is a journey of faith, respect, and mutual care. By following the guidance of the Quran and Sunnah, spouses can build a loving partnership that brings peace in this life and reward in the Hereafter.
